subject: Personal Finance
title: The 4% Rule
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The 4% Rule.

hook.text: Withdraw 4% of your portfolio in year one, then adjust for inflation. Your money should last 30 years.

buildup.text: The 4% rule was developed by financial planner William Bengen in 1994 using historical market data.

discovery.text: With a $1 million portfolio, you'd withdraw $40,000 the first year and increase it with inflation each year.

twist.text: The rule assumes a 50/50 stock-bond mix and US market returns. Different markets or allocations may fail.

climax.text: Many financial planners now suggest 3.5% as safer. Flexibility in spending matters more than any fixed rule.

punchline.text: A useful guideline, not a guarantee.

quiz.question: What does the 4% rule suggest?
options: Withdraw 4% of savings in year one, then adjust for inflation
